B463DDF6664F4A3FA9EA6DAFF4EC5E64.description: Exhibit behavior consistent with the professional ethics required of each of the allied health areas being studied.

BCC44648C7674B12AC07A4D28E826D83.description: Complete One (1) - three (3) observational rotations under the supervision of a duly licensed/certified allied health care professional.

D9F375F30B3C4D3AB0581D4FAA7CA5E6.description: Observe skills in the clinical setting as outlined in the above standard.

3E01CA93C1B24736A3136F3506049A47.description: Successfully complete an observational rotation in at least one (1) to Three (3) major allied health areas.  The student will be able to:

1A16F88CD2C34841841E0F097E0E76FA.description: Discuss sterilization techniques, including proper packaging of sterile goods.

51D4CC36C8694AB599E5CB95CE1971A3.description: Explain how to culture and perform bioassays.

8B64F92CE7E94BBBB72E7F0B0F40B78E.description: Prepare solutions and reagents for laboratory use.

5EF5302B98A84E09A463018546640FC7.description: Discuss the proper utilization of test plants and animals.

0D868BA18378499C87C71D8CFE361A71.description: Discuss environmental conditions of research facility (growth chamber, greenhouse, seed storage room, animal housing or manufacturing site).

1BC696A57ABA4B36879920562D57A714.description: Discuss testing methods and inspection procedures in relation to quality control.

E44FDEB6A7D04392AF7241A72A01DC26.description: Research regulatory bodies (OSHA, NIH, NR, DOT, EPA, CDC, NRC, CLIA, DEA and FDA, etc.).

F185941B1BD44B2AB7A84A03D597C8A0.description: Maintain safe work environment, including but not limited to correct handling, storing, and disposing of hazardous materials, and use of personal protective equipment, etc.

FA27BA5C66354C39A88D035F783DFC48.description: If biomedical research type skills is one of the selected allied health areas to be taught, students will:

C2175A8E0ACF4929981AFF0E385FACC7.description: Calculate a patient's heart rate from the EKG tracing (for example 6-second method).

32D3202DB428490CA2913CF460EB57F9.description: Demonstrate knowledge of, apply and use medical instrumentation modalities.

37A8DADC0A2E45B6A3B297970FDA8D79.description: State precautions required when performing diagnostic procedures.

A26D1937B23B4B8688228D8EC772A8C7.description: Identify patient and verify the requisition order.

E388BDF4768848C3827581B6D2F83094.description: Prepare and maintain all EKG equipment

9F3AAA02E66D434FA0EC218140C34F08.description: Recognize and practice legal and ethical responsibilities as they relate to an EKG tech.

E4BBCE0F1A0746A6A355EDB3AC30C728.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the role and responsibilities of the EKG tech.

32FEC04F33EC4F9797F8317865FBDA65.description: Give the inherent rates for the SA node, the AV junction, and the ventricles.

20B24A26102348D69CC3EC26B10A4270.description: Describe the usual pattern of electrical flow through the conduction system including the five major areas and physical layout.

DDC60EA495DC47ABA94C3445A9A44394.description: Compare and contrast polarization, depolarization and repolarization as it applies to patient care scenarios.

E9299FF3DE434B2EB05D2AA14F7CA460.description: Correlate the electrical conduction system of the heart to the rhythms.

71E0AF73C2D740828DE7A4DF126F11D1.description: Correlate the anatomy of the heart to the placement of leads for an EKG including special needs populations.

78A6269591864221A31A4E247CC46B76.description: If electrocardiograph technician skills are to be taught, students will:

B7E2801E9B504AB98180B83B1030EA0C.description: Describe common medications taken by the elderly and chronically ill, their effects, and side effects.

506DB19436B6434D98D59943DE9F368C.description: Provide appropriate end of life care.

66B79D255D044302B43D9BBDB9B96D8F.description: Recognize common chronic illnesses and the special care required.

D8C82EA83E3E444BBC66ACC0B4BE5643.description: Check integrity of patient’s skin condition and take appropriate actions when needed.

E6FF671CA620420595EB823B773D861B.description: Provide for the safety of the elderly and chronically ill patient, including prevention of falls, prevention of infections, provision of a safe environment and prompt attendance to patients’ needs, etc.

F3C49B7921F744F4A1EAC6A937F34B7A.description: Describe ways to meet the nutritional needs through diet, dietary supplements, and mechanisms to provide supplements.

10DA8B369DA444AFB01C93FEA59DDB32.description: Discuss reality orientation, reminiscing, and validation therapy.

1E410F3B49594BF6A8803B77D7FF4947.description: Recognize the stages of dementia and the care of residents in each stage.

BF3C23E8CA974493A11F445D1D945D03.description: Discuss physical and emotional effects of aging and appropriate ways of dealing with them.

162776D8813C41B680CBEBE9A1B14337.description: Be familiar with legislation affecting long-term care.

F84F29D14E594F7295DB9FCCFF4187DF.description: Recognize types of long term care facilities and levels of care.

FF3233AAF2DA434FA042205CE93CDE4A.description: If geriatric aide type skills are to be taught, students will:

4C55A1317FB14D6EBF3DF469CBEF4ACD.description: Position patient in supine, prone, lateral, oblique, AP, PA, etc. of appropriate part.

84F9C226B6CB40EDAB78791008238177.description: Position x-ray tube to simulate exposure for exam(s) (chest, KUB, hand, and foot, etc.).

18C5A83FE7E64ED586099BE21C8B9FF6.description: Position patient for exam(s) (chest, KUB, hand and foot, etc.).

8A4F6F8C4D4A4E7D96074387E908D0AF.description: Perform safe body mechanics and transferring skills of patient onto x-ray table.

7E6B72138E55455EAABF58225E0D3A5E.description: Explain appropriate exam(s) to the patient.

57CC4D54B32F42F7B828A700D09E859D.description: Identify patient properly to include doing the correct procedure on the correct patient in the right location (check identification band, etc.).

F12F8953BF1E452E90348F7971C17D34.description: Identify anatomical position and terminology medial, lateral, superior, inferior, anterior/ventral, and posterior/dorsal).

036D69D2700C43FDAFA132AFE8795F18.description: Identify the process by which x-ray film is developed.

49B987F0F2CC4F78A15B410F08852032.description: Describe how radiation produces an image on film and through digital technology.

F8696F12CB0340F1A9D579D6199D3889.description: Identify the function of a cassette, film, and screen.

A45832B239554FC5AA12DEAA8A66535C.description: Compare and contrast the development of x-rays through digital media or through film.

99968D07DF47419CBC41ADAC8A4E1D48.description: If radiologic aide type skills is one of the selected allied health areas to be taught, students will:

386BB075D74E4975A6D91E25748F440C.description: Understand the financial terms and procedures involved in operating a medical office practice including, income, expense, accounts receivable, accounts payable, cash and accrual accounting, write-off adjustments.

5D74372430454338AADBB27CA01F9E27.description: Discuss the various types of medical records such as electronic health record (EHR), digital records, and paper records with regard to content and security.

9202FF0A263D4E369E7BBAD409523BCF.description: Develop an understanding of healthcare coverage and be able to interpret the information contained on the patient’s insurance card.

ADFAB3BADC0942DB8EB435110BE3517D.description: Define a release of medical information, explanation of benefit, assignment of benefit, and electronic remittance advice.

EC5A0D44028B45A9B39142FDC516ABCA.description: Understand what is required to create and submit a medical bill

AC7661AE186C43BF8A14D845D052D589.description: List procedures for scheduling and referring patients, handling walk-in emergency patients, and telephone etiquette.

0F77FA8121064DAF9BC395FACFFC7AE7.description: Demonstrate computer literacy, keyboarding and retrieval skills.

14D27767825449F696BE80C711D1565D.description: Demonstrate an understanding of straight numerical, alphabetical and terminal digit filing.

0100A64C295C4A2CA87FE5193353AB4A.description: Demonstrate an understanding of basic medical terminology e.g., prefixes, suffixes, abbreviations, and root words related to major body systems.

647C6F6271F44451ABB01DA33EBF47C1.description: If medical administrative assisting type skills is one of the selected allied health areas to be taught, students will:

6B1021CC5AC9466AAA41CC92DD95DBAE.description: Describe the equipment and use of humidity/aerosol.

558036C61BBC426F9F49ECFC6B560503.description: Discuss and practice the use of the pulse oximeter.

65CEA5BB4C074FDA8CF6C06378A725F3.description: Discuss the use of postural drainage and percussion.

FC7A15BB6D3548F4A2A19A00AEFAA7A9.description: Check emergency equipment assigned to respiratory care.

0CF21E33AF714EACA399273D805376E1.description: Differentiate between various oxygen delivery devices (nasal cannulas, simple and re-breathing masks, oxy-hoods, and enclosures, etc.).

2A394119AF4E440D9D17F02F5B006B42.description: Demonstrate and discuss the use of incentive spirometers.

88AD18644D1C4CB7B93925E16A28DE54.description: Describe the use of oxygen flow regulating equipment.

1534FD1A14A244C0B00F04AF339B8771.description: Recognize normal breath sounds when auscultating the chest with a stethoscope.

F2C794A82EF14727A4B95A3B094A3A40.description: Describe common respiratory diseases (asthma, emphysema, chronic bronchitis, and atelectasis, etc.) and common medications used to treat respiratory diseases.

C15CA4828DDA45169E6AD120E539D351.description: Name and discuss the pathways of respiratory care practice.

A32D209DDFB04CED95D86FE99DC890CE.description: If respiratory restorative aide type skills is one of the selected allied health areas to be taught, students will:

1DE01FAA63E54C0F942C8B9F80070758.description: Educate the client in activities of daily living skills such as clothing care skills, food preparation, and money management, etc.

629615870A88443D838D49C695380728.description: Name and discuss the pathways of occupational therapy practice.

C0CCC8039AEB43DD949D3FBB2A097919.description: Perform and instruct range of motion exercises.

83C72428B9734D12AAE43B5CFE798FF1.description: Perform communication skills specifically related to occupational therapy.

275C290FD0DC4F9E86BE0F824E5C9D63.description: Perform feeding and dressing skills using one hand.

0BE8842261D443F6AB550B66ECB12332.description: Perform feeding and dressing skills using adaptive equipment.

FF42A224CC344CFC9937D872A829013F.description: Describe equipment used in occupational therapy.

6CA14736D7BA47BF9DB0F43679976A90.description: Identify augmented communication devices and purposes of each.

6D2AC0F02AB34B95B7EFFF566DAD4D25.description: Assist clients to eat using prompting.

A7950B2786684536A7087AA603518F72.description: If occupational restorative aide type skills is one of the selected allied health areas to be taught, students will:

C3ED23E50C4C41F8AF4CC310FBBEC872.description: Describe the relationship between long-term and short-term goals.

36A8ED34F4BB4C23BDBA271ECB4D8610.description: Demonstrate techniques used in active and passive range of motion exercises.

303CC960318E47E8BE1027903582A940.description: Identify, describe, and demonstrate the use of devices such as crutches, walkers, canes, and wheelchairs, etc.

AC1AFC40FD584ECDAF79DD30DCD24BBD.description: Perform communication skills specifically related to physical therapy aide.

C20A8B2ABA274CCFA4CE2DB432A33F37.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the use of modalities (i.e., Ultrasound, heat and cold therapeutic massage, E-STEM, wound care, elastic stockings, etc.).

1222C65244D84BEE94F024999524EAD3.description: Perform safe body mechanics and transfer

A35BD81DCD5849AEBFA899F84072ED02.description: Describe equipment used in physical therapy.

80EADB3DF80844AFBBBFC73652997FE1.description: Name and discuss the pathways of physical therapy practice.

327E07FCDC504BB0B8F787B888D83253.description: Define disability and identify types of disabilities.

4538A5A4FB394C11920AC8684E22FEEB.description: Describe the functions of bones and muscles as related to the practice of physical therapy.

80515F1B453D4CDCA6E7B390E77518F0.description: If physical restorative aide type skills is one of the selected allied health areas to be taught, students will:

06CA335240CB473697420B6A59443DEC.description: Explain the levels and qualifications for testing personnel as set forth in CLIA (complexity based) and as established by state law (licensure categories).

020899E4F54D498B8B5F9AC291EBD2B0.description: Explain the criteria set forth in CLIA to classify laboratory testing as waived, moderate complexity or high complexity.

E6DBD1C2302C4FD09AFCB0D80EBCEB7F.description: Name and discuss the specialty areas within laboratory (hematology, clinical chemistry, microbiology, etc.).

F0BAB24B7894425D8579472CBAEA3935.description: Discuss the process of performing various venipunctures.

624BCA24927A41AEB47D3F2E3D0249B2.description: Perform communication skills specifically related to laboratory science.

D3E72B2CC78549FF8838FFAFC57982DD.description: Identify and explain the use of the common instruments/equipment found in the clinical laboratory.

DEAA526FD0E449A081AE96AC7DAA6321.description: Report urine specific gravity, color and characteristics.

15F3FE63498448DD96B58441201B8EF7.description: Describe the process for preparing a blood slides for differential blood count.

829398064B5C4692BD9503A62D4378AF.description: Perform waived testing on blood and urine.

481993E9F93E4C4B8F276ABA60971F2E.description: If clinical laboratory aide type skills is one of the selected allied health areas to be taught, only procedures that are exempt from clinical laboratory personnel licensure requirements will be presented and students will:

325B2B75A8FC47D1A0DB2BA0EE7A1F0D.description: Perform skills representative of 1-3 major allied health areas in the school laboratory before beginning the observational phase.  The student will be able to:
